question.t: 關於一個擁有 N 個節點的樹 (Tree)，下列哪一個敘述是絕對正確的？
question.en: Which of the following statements is absolutely true for a tree with N nodes?

question.t: 假設該樹為非空且連通的結構。
question.en: Assume the tree is a non-empty and connected structure.

options.t: (A) 它恰好有 N 個邊 (Edges)。
options.en: (A) It has exactly N edges.

options.t: (B) 它恰好有 N-1 個邊。
options.en: (B) It has exactly N-1 edges.

options.t: (C) 它必須是一個二元樹 (Binary Tree)。
options.en: (C) It must be a Binary Tree.

options.t: (D) 它包含至少一個環 (Cycle)。
options.en: (D) It contains at least one cycle.

why.t: 樹的定義是一個連通且無環的圖。
why.en: A tree is defined as a connected and acyclic graph.

question.t: 若對一個二元搜尋樹 (BST) 進行中序遍歷 (In-order Traversal)，其輸出的節點順序具備什麼特性？
question.en: If you perform an In-order Traversal on a Binary Search Tree (BST), what property does the output sequence of nodes possess?

options.t: (A) 節點數值由大到小排序。
options.en: (A) The node values are sorted in descending order.

options.t: (B) 節點數值由小到大排序。
options.en: (B) The node values are sorted in ascending order.

options.t: (C) 根節點會最後被輸出。
options.en: (C) The root node is output last.

options.t: (D) 順序是隨機的。
options.en: (D) The order is random.

why.t: BST 的特性是左子樹的所有值小於根節點，右子樹的所有值大於根節點。
why.en: The property of a BST is that all values in the left subtree are smaller than the root, and all values in the right subtree are larger than the root.

keywords: BST, Time Complexity, Worst Case, Big O

question.t: 在最差的情況下 (Worst Case)，於二元搜尋樹 (BST) 中搜尋一個特定值的時間複雜度為何？
question.en: What is the time complexity of searching for a specific value in a Binary Search Tree (BST) in the worst case?

question.t: 假設樹中有 n 個節點。
question.en: Assume there are n nodes in the tree.

options.t: (B) O(log n)
options.en: (B) O(log n)

options.t: (C) O(n)
options.en: (C) O(n)

options.t: (D) O(n log n)
options.en: (D) O(n log n)

why.t: 當 BST 嚴重傾斜 (Skewed) 時，例如每個節點都只有右子節點，其結構會退化成類似連結串列 (Linked List)。
why.en: When a BST is severely skewed, for example, if every node only has a right child, its structure degenerates into something similar to a Linked List.

keywords: Complete Binary Tree, Array, Data Structure

question.t: 下列關於完全二元樹 (Complete Binary Tree) 的敘述，何者正確？
question.en: Which of the following statements about a Complete Binary Tree is true?

options.t: (A) 每個節點都必須有兩個子節點。
options.en: (A) Every node must have two children.

options.t: (B) 除了最後一層外，其他層的節點都必須填滿，且最後一層的節點須靠左排列。
options.en: (B) Except for the last level, all other levels must be fully filled, and nodes in the last level must be aligned to the left.

options.t: (C) 它不適合使用陣列 (Array) 來儲存。
options.en: (C) It is not suitable to be stored using an Array.

options.t: (D) 它的高度永遠是 n。
options.en: (D) Its height is always n.

why.t: 這是完全二元樹的定義，這種結構確保了樹的高度保持在 O(log n) 且非常適合用陣列實作。
why.en: This is the definition of a Complete Binary Tree; this structure ensures the tree height remains at O(log n) and is very suitable for array implementation.

question.t: 在一個最大堆積 (Max-Heap) 中，數值最大的元素位於何處？
question.en: In a Max-Heap, where is the element with the largest value located?

options.t: (A) 根節點 (Root)。
options.en: (A) The Root node.

options.t: (B) 最底層最右邊的葉節點。
options.en: (B) The rightmost leaf node on the bottom level.

options.t: (C) 最底層最左邊的葉節點。
options.en: (C) The leftmost leaf node on the bottom level.

options.t: (D) 任意一個葉節點。
options.en: (D) Any leaf node.

why.t: 堆積性質 (Heap Property) 規定在最大堆積中，父節點的值必須大於或等於其子節點的值。
why.en: The Heap Property dictates that in a Max-Heap, the value of a parent node must be greater than or equal to the values of its children.
